story.text: [http://www.stevemcconnell.com/ www.stevemcconnell.com]
Steve founded Construx Software Builders, Inc. Steve was also Editor-in-Chief of [[Ieee Software]] from 1998 to 2002.
He also wrote [[Code Complete]] (a bible), [[Rapid Development]] (another bible), [[Software Project Survival Guide]] and [[After The Gold Rush]] (total crap).
Readers of [[Software Development Magazine]] voted Steve the third most influential person in software (coming after [[Bill Gates]] and [[Linus Torvalds]]).
Not to be confused with [[Steve Maguire]], another author and former [[Micro Soft]] developer.
The draft of the 2nd edition of [[After The Gold Rush]] is up on his website at: [http://www.stevemcconnell.com/gr2.htm www.stevemcconnell.com]
After The Gold Rush has been updated and re-released with the title [[Professional Software Development]].
<hr>
[[Category Author]] [[Category Person]]
See original on  [http://c2.com/cgi/wiki?SteveMcConnell c2.com]
